com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec

Interface Buffer


  • public interface Buffer
    UPA Buffer represents some type of user-provided content along with the content's length.

    Used by data encoder/decoder and message packages. The Buffer has a position and length. When accessing the backing data, use position() for the position and length() for the length, not the position and limit of the ByteBuffer returned from data().Blank buffers are conveyed as a length() of 0.

    Buffer can:

    • Represent various buffer and string types, such as ASCII, RMTES, or UTF8 strings.
    • Contain or reference encoded data on both container and message header structures.

    • Method Detail

      • data

        int data(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        Sets the Buffer data to the ByteBuffer. This buffer's position and length will be taken from the specified ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        data - the ByteBuffer data to set.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, or CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if data is null.

      • data

        int data(java.nio.ByteBuffer data,
         int position,
         int length)
        Sets the Buffer data to the ByteBuffer. This buffer's position and length will be set to the specified position and length.
        Parameters:
        data - the ByteBuffer to set.
        position - the data's starting position.
        length - the data's length.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if data is null, or if position or length is outside of the data's capacity.

      • data

        java.nio.ByteBuffer data()
        Gets the underlying ByteBuffer. Do not use the position and limit from the ByteBuffer. Use position() and length() from the Buffer.
        Returns:
        1. If this Buffer is backed by a ByteBuffer then the ByteBuffer's reference will be returned.
        2. If this Buffer is backed by a String, then a new ByteBuffer will be created from a new byte[] from the backing String. Note that this creates garbage.

      • copy

        int copy(java.nio.ByteBuffer destBuffer)
        Copies this Buffer's data starting at this Buffer's position, for this Buffer's length, into the destBuffer starting at the destBuffer's position.
        Parameters:
        destBuffer - A ByteBuffer large enough to hold the contents of this Buffer.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if the destBuffer is null, or CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the destBuffer is too small.
        See Also:
        length()

      • copy

        int copy(byte[] destBuffer)
        Copies this Buffer's data starting at this Buffer's position, for this Buffer's length, into the destBuffer.
        Parameters:
        destBuffer - A byte[] large enough to hold the contents of this Buffer.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if the destBuffer is null, or CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the destBuffer is too small.
        See Also:
        length()

      • copy

        int copy(byte[] destBuffer,
         int destOffset)
        Copies this Buffer's data starting at this Buffer's position, for this Buffer's length, into the destBuffer.
        Parameters:
        destBuffer - A byte[] large enough to hold the contents of this Buffer.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if the destBuffer is null, or CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the destBuffer is too small.
        See Also:
        length()

      • copy

        int copy(Buffer destBuffer)
        Copies this Buffer's data starting at this Buffer's position, for this Buffer's length, into the destBuffer starting at the destBuffer's position.
        Parameters:
        destBuffer - A Buffer backed by a ByteBuffer large enough to hold the contents of this Buffer.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if the destBuffer is null, the backing buffer is null or the backing buffer is a String, or CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the destBuffer is too small.
        See Also:
        length(), position()

      • length

        int length()
        The backing ByteBuffer is initially set along with initial position and length. This method returns the initial length if there was no operation on the backing ByteBuffer that would change the position (such as get or put). If the backing ByteBuffer position has been changed by reading or writing to the buffer, this method returns the change in position, i.e. difference between current position and initial position.
        Returns:
        the length

      • position

        int position()
        Returns the initial position of the buffer.
        Returns:
        the position

      • data

        int data(java.lang.String str)
        Sets the Buffer data to the contents of the string. This buffer's position will be set to zero and length will be set to the specified string's length.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to set
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, or CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if data is null.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Converts the underlying buffer into a String. This should only be called when the Buffer is known to contain ASCII data. This method creates garbage unless the underlying buffer is a String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String representation

      • toHexString

        java.lang.String toHexString()
        Converts the underlying buffer into a formatted hexidecimal String. This method creates garbage.
        Returns:
        the formatted hexadecimal String representation.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the buffer by setting its underlying ByteBuffer to null and its length and position to 0. If the underlying ByteBuffer is not referenced in any other place, it will be a subject to GC.

      • isBlank

        boolean isBlank()
        Returns true if the Buffer has been decoded as blank.

      • equals

        boolean equals(Buffer buffer)
        Tests if this Buffer is equal to another Buffer. The two objects are equals if they have the same length and the two sequence of elements are equal.

        If one buffer is backed by a String and the other buffer is backed by a ByteBuffer, the String will be compared as 8-bit ASCII.

        Parameters:
        buffer - A Buffer.
        Returns:
        true if equals, otherwise false.

      • encode

        int encode(EncodeIterator iter)
        Encodes a Buffer.
        Parameters:
        iter - The encoder iterator.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes
        See Also:
        EncodeIterator

      • decode

        int decode(DecodeIterator iter)
        Decodes a Buffer.
        Parameters:
        iter - The decoder iterator.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes
        See Also:
        DecodeIterator

      • capacity

        int capacity()
        Returns the capacity of this buffer. If underlying data is backed by ByteBuffer, capacity is the difference between limit and initial position of the backing ByteBuffer. For String backed buffer, capacity is the string length.
        Returns:
        the capacity. Number of bytes that this buffer can hold.
